intro: Asplundia platanthera, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant features a slender, erect stem with a few leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers. Asplundia platanthera is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in forest understories. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
